intro: Erythranthe visibilis, commonly known as the visible monkeyflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Phrymaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant red-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils along streambanks and in woodland areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Erythranthe visibilis plays an important role in supporting local pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
